alert.note: Alert for Spencer (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued August 01 at 8:36PM EDT until August 01 at 11:00PM EDT by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 800 PM CDT FOR SOUTHWESTERN SPENCER...EAST CENTRAL HENDERSON AND CENTRAL DAVIESS COUNTIES... At 735 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Stanley, or 11 miles south of Newburgh, moving southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. This severe storm will be near... Stanley around 740 PM CDT. Owensboro around 745 PM CDT. Masonville around 805 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by this severe thunderstorm include Moseleyville and Hebbardsville. This includes the following highways... Interstate 165 between Mile Markers 66 and 70. Audubon Parkway between Mile Markers 13 and 23. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
